body_content.explanation: used to describe an isomer (= one of a group of similar chemical substances) in which the atoms are arranged on opposite sides of the molecule, especially on opposite sides of a carbon bond (= connected carbon atoms):
examples: In the hydrogenization process, trans fatty acids are created.
The double bond can re-form as either cis or trans.

body_content.explanation:
short for
transgender : used to describe a person whose gender does not match the body they were born with:
examples: I want to offer support to anyone who's going through a hard time because they're trans.

body_content.explanation: changing or having changed from one thing to another:
examples: Kate has transformed (= completely changed the appearance of) that house since she moved in.
I accidently transposed two letters (= put each one in the other letter's place) when I typed my password.

body_content.explanation: used to form the names of chemical substances in which the atoms are arranged on opposite sides of the molecule, especially on opposite sides of a carbon bond (= connected carbon atoms):
examples: In some human studies fat loss is accompanied by impairment in insulin sensitivity, especially when using the trans-10, cis-12 isomer.
